"While this round of changes doesn’t get Aatrox where he should be in the long-term"

These are awful changes. You gutted him, and gutted him hard. There was 2 years of input from Aatrox mains on the boards, and you decided to ignore all of it.

He needs 5 stacks to get Blood Rush right? Okay, but all of his abilities are on a long cool down, and using Blood Price for the stacks means you aren't healing. The only buff his healing got was is it is higher now over 50 percent then previously. So basically in order to benefit from the healing you have not be using your now nerfed bonus damage, and also won't be getting stacks.

Furthermore, the blood well drains faster than it used to. It drains immediately, and quickly. It drains WAY to fast. And because his Blood Well takes so long to fill up, if it ever drains to zero, you have no revive and its hard to quickly stack back up.

He does less damage now too, and receives less bonus Attack Speed. Even with his Blood Rush passive, that extra 29 damage at level 18 doesn't mean nearly as much as 100 percent bonus AD on top of a 200 bonus damage from his old Blood Price.

If you are going to move his damage output to his passive, it needs to be stronger. A flat 25% base damage is not enough. Put it in his W and E were it belongs. Gut the damage on his Q and lower the cool down and widen the knock up area.

This is a colossal screw up. Its not fun and its annoying.

Solution? Well if we must stick with this new set up, instead of his abilities filling up 20% they should fill 25%, and the stacks should simply remain stay even out of combat or at least remain for so he can strategically stack and plan a dive. The Blood Well drains way too fast. First of all it now drains IMMEDIATELY after you stop attacking or being attacked. There should be a several second window where it doesn't drain, and then it should drain over 10 seconds. He needs a window out of combat where his passive is available.

Don't kid yourselves--this was a total nerf. Either it was intentional, or it was gross incompetence, and neither one is acceptable. Riot has yet to respond to any post about Aatrox, even when it was in PBE.

I just can't believe after 2 years this was the best they could come up with. A multi-billion dollar company. Very sad.
it's not a rework. it's literally just a stop gap measure until they can give him the attention he deserves.

Aatrox main here as well(Pickel Lang if you want to search me up), I would've prefered having him like he was before than now. At least before I could fend for myself and it actually pushed me to become better considering aatrox is god awful this season. (I was forced to learn basically every nook and cranny about Aatrox, his match ups etc.) Now for the screw up...

First off if you're not going to spend a lot of time in a champion then why even bother changing his kit? I mean why is Aatrox the odd ball?

1.) His damage is significantly lower, it's  one of the first things I noticed. 

2.)His attack speed is so low even with the buff it's disgusting. Like seriously before I could get multiple autos off with botrk alone, but now I have to rely on a buff that seems awfully like darius'(Hit 5 stacks get ad and attack speed, except darius' is actually VERY useful to his kit)

3.)While the buff is ALRIGHT it could be better, and it certainly doesn't match his old one. It's too hard to stack considering his cooldowns and it shouldn't decay either as quick or at all if they're going to keep his CDs the same.

4.)His overall kit is kinda ruined. His w + atk speed was his strong point, the new heal is good don't get me wrong but his blood price does nearly nothing. Q also needs to have a non interrupt, like for real it's annoying and should be a thing already(It's basically malphite ult but not as strong? In a way)

Now for the changes that I would like to see since they most likely won't revert him.

1.)His passive...it needs a lot of work. Why would you make his revive conditional? Like really, its the only reason Aatrox is actually played somewhat and it also makes him slightly viable.(You really can't tell me otherwise because all you really need is a good team or champion. Take fiora for example, that lane is HORRENDOUS for Aatrox.)Anyways moving on...something I noticed while discussing with a few friends is that, his new passive stack and buff is awfully similar to Darius'. This would be great if he totally didn't rely on it to actually do something. Like DarkRaygnar already said, it's WAY too difficult to stack and it decays in an instant. Either buff the passive to have it scale by HP or per level or reduce the number of stacks to 3-4(1 Q, 1-2 Blood price, 1 E).

2.)Passive attack speed either scales with the bars or you bump his actual attack speed stat up. (Even with atk speed runes and masteries I get 0.91 at lvl 2, before I could easily hit 1.16 or higher depending on my setup).The reason why his attack speed is so important is because it allows him to proc W more, and guess what? Its also his sustain. 

3.)I honestly have no clue how to fix new blood price cause it's all types of bad lmao, but I guess you could bump up the flat ad #'s. 

Last but not least...either revert E to magic or change ult to physical as well. I don't understand the logic behind changing one but not the other... Also E actually did a lot of damage early on in the game considering it was magic


It seems like you guys are trying to make Aatrox a tank of some sort, kind of like darius?

Honestly, I was pretty disappointed to see my old main get changed but for the worse. There's a lot of work needed to make him great again. Also please please please, there's no one better to ask for a champions changes then the community themselves, better yet ask someone who MAINS the champion. Most people will complain about this and that but don't actually understand how to counter that particular champion
also fellow aatrox main i havent gotten a chance to play aatrox well this version yet im glad i didnt cause i would have been disappointed, ty fellow aatrox mains {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
Yeah no kidding. The only reason I found out about the change was from a friend, I wish he had never told me. RIP fellow aatrox mains!{{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}

No more "stop gap measures." This is annoying. Listen to what the community is saying or stop pretending like you do. Simple as that really.

nah dude it's instantly downvoted because it's an emotional knee-jerk that reads like a livestock squeal more than a cogent piece of "valuable criticism". i'm an enthusiastic aatrox player who has been sad to see him be totally unplayable recently, and i'm excited to try these changes out in toplane.
Who me? My post is an emotional knee-jerk?  Really. So on what grounds do you disagree with my assessment and criticism of the changes?

i disagree on the grounds that you're being intentionally dense! at your elo, i can understand the confusion -- you're probably either pubstomping kids who don't understand aatrox's kit, or one (1) person on the other team builds heal reduction and you're out of the game. the issue is that at anything higher than bronze three, the latter is a constant, and it (among a litany of other modern-meta woes) leaves aatrox in a functionally unworkable place for anything approaching competitive. 

to boot: _anything_ would be better than where he is right now, including this (admitted) stop-gap measure. i _like_ the fact that new-aatrox is being rewarded for building tankier, and i _understand_ that this comes at a direct damage cost. this isn't being billed as a complete aatrox rework, and i would find your dissatisfaction more understandable (although still perplexing in scope) if it were billed as such. but it's not! it's a stop-gap; they're experimenting with new levers to push and pull on; they'll only get more data through experimentation.

for future reference, my man, people will respond better to posts if you, like, take a deep breath first. remove the emotional ("very sad"; "awful"; "gross incompetence"; etc) language from your "valuable criticism" if you want it to be read as such. mwah!

So the sad part about all the rants from these changes is simply that no one seems to understand what was said."we hope we’ve made enough strides here for him to be buff-and-nerf-able state until that update comes." that statement there is what they were going for. Not making changes to him as he was before made him untouchable for buff/nerf as far as riot was concerned. Another words it was always going to be a lose/lose situation should they have tried to do buffs/nerfs in the condition prior to these changes. That is literally what riot has said about these changes."In Patch 7.5, we decided to roll up our sleeves and do what we could to make Aatrox more safely tuneable. ". So the changes were intended to allow riot to watch in competitive game modes to see how these changes can be adjusted to make him a better champion with the existence of the new/reworked champions. Does this make him playable? Yes, though not the way he used to be played. Aatrox mains will unfortunately have to relearn how to engage and farm with him, but honestly with the abilities of new/reworked champions he was gradually being left in an uplayable position, or at the very least not in a position that riot could touch up with updates. Everyone needs to realize that balancing a champion takes a lot of effort and TIME. The effort has been done with these changes now all it needs is time so that the balancing can take effect. His passive drain? That is something that can be addressed in a later patch depending on what needs to be adjusted. Simply stating it needs to be "X" solves nothing. Playtime in competitive settings will allow players and riot to see how adjustments could sway one way or the other vs the 100+ champions vs items. Remember very clearly. This was a change only to make him able to be adjusted. Nothing more. It is not intended to be a buff/nerf in any way shape or form. It was simply meant to make him capable of being buff/nerfed in the new format that has always been constantly changing with the existence of new items/champion abilities.

Awful changes. I understand this is essentially a band-aide to fixing the overall issues with Aatrox, but for the time being you have neutered this champion beyond belief. I used to absolutely love him, and would concede to the fact that what you described about getting out ahead and becoming a god through insane lifesteal could at times be broken. This was the solution though? Why throw a half-assed attempt at a temporary solution. You would have been better off deactivating him while you worked on his issues as compared to this... I believe that's exactly what was done with GP, but I could be remembering wrong. Just because its a stop gap doesn't mean you don't have to put any thought or attention into it.

Um, yea that "you guys remove anti-heal items"  would be a mistake. Some games the only way to stop a few players are those Anti-heal items as you mentioned, Executioner was missed when it was gone and Morellonomicon doea not seem to be enough but it helps. I disagree completely. Some some champs are built for x(rapid lifesteal), and you have to build in response to it not stick to the same script. Not all champs take ignite, but it seems to be making its way back. If you don't want to build it get the support to build it, but you better hope they don't get exploded first.

And it's not like anti-heal items are strictly necessary against drain-tank champions, or that they completely nullify them. If Aatrox is massacring your team faster than you can even target him anti-heal items aren't going to fix that, but if he's able to survive prolonged dives without melting you all that fast, then anti-heal items are going to help. If Swain is walking through a fight with impunity, you can certainly make him a lot more vulnerable when he does that if you cut his sustain, but that won't stop him from landing his basic abilities at range, or outputting his ult damage from safety. Self-healing is never the only strength of a champ, nor is cutting it their only weakness.
